Summary Specialties:LEED AP, Influencing Stakeholders, Critical Path Scheduling, Agile Software Development Methodologies, Project Leadership Summary Specialties:LEED AP, Influencing Stakeholders, Critical Path Scheduling, Agile Software Development Methodologies, Project Leadership Specialties:LEED AP, Influencing Stakeholders, Critical Path Scheduling, Agile Software Development Methodologies, Project Leadership Specialties:LEED AP, Influencing Stakeholders, Critical Path Scheduling, Agile Software Development Methodologies, Project Leadership Experience D1X MOD2 Manufacturing Support Building Project Manager Intel Corporation November 2012  – Present (2 years 10 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Cleanroom Project Manager Intel Corporation March 2012  –  November 2012  (9 months) D1X - Ronler Acres, Hillsboro, Oregon Schedule Integration Manager Intel Corporation June 2010  –  March 2012  (1 year 10 months) Schedule Platform Manager Intel Corporation September 2000  –  June 2010  (9 years 10 months) As a scheduling and construction expert I am currently partnering with IT to manage the suite of construction scheduling systems to enable better project support and decision making. As a platform manager this position requires me to blend my construction management techniques with proven software management techniques (Agile) and expanding my overall project management knowledgebase. To effectively manage the schedule platform I need vast knowledge not only of Intel's construction practices but also the manufacturing long range planning processes and systems. I am also a key team member on our Re-Plan In A Day (RPIAD) Team. This team is developing break through capabilities that analyze utility system capacities and demands over time with just the touch of a few buttons. This real time analysis will provide complete information to decision makers enabling capital spending decisions that allow Intel to better respond to market demands. This advanced technology is earning our team recognition from FIATECH and other industry consortia. Business Manager Intel Corporation 2007  –  2008  (1 year) Business Manager for two large groups within Intel’s global construction department. Here I researched, developed and implemented software and supporting business processes to manage dynamic resource needs. My solution allowed the Project Engineering team to better understand the roadmap of construction projects and the skill sets required to support those projects and compare those demands against the capabilities of the organization. This comparison allowed us to see where our resource gaps existed and mitigate those risks through hiring, headcount reassignment or managing the gap as a risk if appropriate. Schedule Group Lead Intel Corporation 2005  –  2007  (2 years) In charge of developing and implementing standardized scheduling methodologies throughout Intel’s global Assembly Test facilities. This position was focused on implementing Primavera and the suite of scheduling software applications in China, Costa Rica, Philippines and Malaysia. While working on this project I lived in Costa Rica for 1 year and travelled extensively through Asia learning to adapt to a wide variety of business cultures. I also trained the permanent workforce to manage the process long term enabling myself to move to the next project without any impacts to the project teams. Project Manager Intel Corporation 2002  –  2004  (2 years) Project Manager for the construction and installation of manufacturing tools and equipment. This project was further complicated because all of the construction work was performed in an operating manufacturing facility requiring adherence to strict protocols. Additionally, was the PM for the New Mexico site demolition activities. This project consisted of the safe demolition of hundreds of manufacturing tools within an operating factory. During this project I lead teams of hundreds of craft personal as well as Intel technicians. This project broke world class safety records for 44 consecutive weeks with zero safety incidents or unsafe observations. Integration Scheduler Intel Corporation 2000  –  2002  (2 years) Managed the construction schedule on the construction of F11X, the world’s first 300mm high volume manufacturing facility. Here I was in charge of integrating the construction schedule for the base building with the construction schedule of the installation of the manufacturing tools/equipment. On this high profile project I developed a unique indicator that linked the schedule data with the AutoCAD layout to create a 2D model of the build out of the factory production space through time. This innovative tool enabled millions of dollars in savings through cost avoidance as planning issues were discovered and resolved before the occurred. Among other awards, I authored a paper and was invited to speak at the International Symposium on Semiconductor Manufacturing on this breakthrough work. Project Manager Gardner Zemke 1995  –  2000  (5 years) Worked as a construction project manager for this large industrial electrical contractor. Gained experience managing projects spanning the full spectrum of possibilities. Just a few of the projects I worked on during this period are: Upgrading NASA Mission Control Switchgear, Pantex High Explosive Synthesis Facility, Shiprock Hospital, Hoffman AFB Wastewater Treatment Plant, upgrades to Lackland AFB Power Plant, Texas Dept of Criminal Justice Jail Facilities and more. This position also allowed me to work on both public and privately owned facilities, lump sum, design build and negotiated contracts as well as managing projects as both sub and prime contractors. Summary Hoa is a Technical Project Manager at Intel Corporation, leading a strategic program conducting collaborative research in several technical disciplines.  
 
Hoa is taking his third sabbatical after twenty-one year of service with the company - an inflection point in his professional career, when new challenges and opportunities are sought to rejuvenate the passion for excellencies and services.  
 
Hoa is a strategic thinker and planner; an adept technologist who apprehends technology barriers in many areas at different phases of semiconductor design and manufacturing, then translate them into achievable objectives for innovation. Hoa is an effective communicator, interfacing with cross-team technologists in many areas while driving contribution from stakeholders in and outside of the company- communicate goals, progress, and roadblocks, influence decisions, persuade of changes, and drive towards fruitful results. Through solid engineering education, work experience and years of continuing education, Hoa grows expertise in system architecture, micro-architecture, verification, CAD tools, manufacturing test, and emerging trends such as hardware security for IoT, device driver synthesis and NVM enabling.  
 
Hoa is also an authorized expert in handling Intellectual Property (IP) to avoid costly legal issues for the company - protection, compliance and licensing negotiation. Hoa develops cost effective, win-win collaboration models with institutions to fuel strategic innovation, and is recognized as the go-to person for “hiring” scholars in the company. 
 
Hoa reviews proposals and advises for several industry consortium groups and government agencies. He served as Chair/Vice-Chair for several semiconductor consortia, a member of the Technical Advisory Board for the Semiconductor Research Corporation since 2000, and frequently served in relevant semiconductor industry panels. Experience Technical Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2000  – Present (15 years 8 months) Folsom, CA I am a technical project manager at Intel Corporation, leading a path-finding, multi-disciplinary technical program. The program is mission-ed with nurturing solutions for some of the most challenging, long term and high impact technical barriers in various phases of product development – those that exceed routine engineering effort, and require a collaborative partnership between in house expertise and industry, institution and government resources, under rigorous IP agreements and regulation compliance. 
 
I develop strategic needs, define and partition research problems, drive teams of experts in and outside of the company, from different culture and background, facilitating their collaboration and contribution to final deliverable. Skilled in working with Intellectual Property (IP) issues, protection and compliance. Understanding institutions' IP practice and win-win IP right negotiation. Expert in Open Source Software and licensing. 
 
I review proposals and advise industry consortium groups and government agencies for funding in hardware security, test and verification, architecture and resiliency. I have served as Chair of GRC industry consortia “Trustworthy and Secure Semiconductors and Systems” (2015), “Integrated System Design” (2012), “Computer Aided Design, Test and Testability” (2008) and on Technical Advisory Boards for the consortia since 2000. Computer Architect Intel Corporation May 1997  –  January 2000  (2 years 9 months) Folsom, CA Early design micro architecture exploration for CPU and system performance and power optimization, architecture validation, benchmark generation. Intel's MMX and MMX2 Architecture Extended Instruction Set for multimedia application. Intel's first 5V NOR Flash technology product. Summary I am a program manager and technologist at Intel. I began working at Intel in 1996 supporting Internet applications and compression algorithms in the Intel Architecture Lab I then spent ten years managing various enterprise-level software implementations supporting the Intel software developer community, Intel Health, and Intel Customer Support. After a two year stint working with a new business incubation team, I shifted gears to support a series of software scaling and firmware configuration initiatives. 
 
I balance a data-driven decision making discipline with thoughtful diplomacy delivered with a dose of subtle humor. While I have mastered the nuts and bolts of project initiation, planning, execution, and control, my core strength is my ability to listen attentively, adapt and resolve problems without becoming emotionally entangled in the moment. I strive to create project environments where team members are both empowered to perform and appreciated for the results they achieve. After all, project management is all about the people.  
 
I am a PMP-credentialed Project Manager specializing in globally distributed, organizationally complex, software and product development projects.  
 
I crave innovation and like to spend time fiddling with microcontrollers and other simple yet useful electronic gadgets. I contribute to crowd-sourced projects at a level that will likely require intervention at some point. :-) I wear a smart watch and fitness tracker and I am always on the lookout for that next high-utility wearable device promising to make life better, longer, easier… 
 
I am an Intel social media practitioner, pragmatic futurist, and crypto-currency & micro-lending hobbyist. I enjoy soccer, running and hiking...and at the end of the day, I often make time to enjoy a quality northwest craft-brewed ale.

Summary 16+ Years in R&D, Engineering, Leadership and Technical Project Management roles. 
Proven success in delivery and enablement of  
+ SoCs, Testchips (14nm, 45nm, 65nm), Wireless HW Digital IP development 
+ Complex Chip Architectures, Design Systems, Test Platforms and Methodologies 
+ Knowledge and exposure to every aspect of Requirements to GDS flow 
+ Significant overseas experience in US start-ups (Wireless, Wireline and security domains) 
+ Extensive collaborative experience with cross-functional/cross-cultural teams across the globe.  
+ Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and leadership skills with profound engineering aptitude. 
 
Application Domain Strengths:  
Wearables, IOT, Wireless & Wired Communication systems and Automotive Semiconductors. 
 
Platform Strengths:  
Soft IP development, FPGAs, ASICs, SoCs and Testchip development. 
 
Core Strengths: 
Project Management, System Architecture, Micro Architecture, Digital HW IP Development, RTL Design, Functional Verification, Rapid Prototyping, Virtual Prototyping, Co-Simulation, Platform Emulation, Mobile Platform Development, 2G, 2.5G, 3G, 4G(LTE), 10/100/1000 Ethernet and Multi-Gigabit Ethernet based Product Development, Optical networking technologies like PON and GPON, TCP Offload Engines, PCI, PCI-Express, Advanced Switching based Switch Development. Interfacing with analog blocks like PLLs, ADCs, DACs, Analog PHYs, IO Pads etc.
